subject: Re: JUnit 4.x and support for Java 1.4
msgSnippet: At the risk of criticism for replying to my own post ... If a version of JUnit 4 were made available for Java 1.4 - my personal preferrence might be to have a
messageBody:
At the risk of criticism for replying to my own post ...

If a version of JUnit 4 were made available for Java 1.4 - my
personal preferrence might be to have a base class extension style
of API with call back methods similar to JUnit 3. (Note: A more
standard call back syntax ... i.e. use preTest()/postTest() [or even
preTestCB()/postTestCB()] to wrap setUp()/testDown() could be
favored.)

This provides a comfortable migration (learning) path for developers
and, more importantly, provides a strategy to leverage all of the
convenience extensions companies have built upon JUnit 3.

If one prefers JavaDoc annotations you can always use TestNG. Why
go down that path a second time?


_Marvin


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Marvin D. Toll" <MarvinToll@...>
wrote:
>
>
>
> I'd like to reinforce Mark's message. In southeastern MI - I'd
concur that
> Fortune Five companies (and many smaller) are two (plus) years
away from
> moving to Java 1.5 and indirections .. er . I mean annotations.
>
>
> _Marvin
>
